bchat.streamer_warning.title:
Streamer Note:
§lTurn on the STREAMER mode
§rFor the sake of platform restrictions,
display chat messages can be dangerous
especially for streamers from Bilibili .etc
bchat.configuration.title: Bullet Chat Configurations
bchat.configuration.bullet_speed.tooltip:
Speed of bullets
Unit: SPs per tick
default: 2.0
bchat.configuration.bullet_life.tooltip:
Life of centered bullets
Unit: ticks (1/20 sec)
default: 160
bchat.configuration.max_bullet.tooltip:
Max number of bullets displayed on screen
default: 200
bchat.configuration.min_fps.tooltip:
When client fps lower than configured, new bullets will not launch
default: 30
bchat.configuration.show_sender.tooltip:
Whether to show senders name before bullets
default: false
bchat.configuration.mode.tooltip:
Display mode of bullet chat, allowed values are listed below:
NORMAL: show bullets, show chats
HIDE_CHAT: show bullets, hide chats
HIDE_BULLET: show chats, hide bullets
STREAMER: hide bullets, hide chats
ALWAYS_ASK: choose once enter a world
default: ALWAYS_ASK
bchat.configuration.parse_tell.tooltip:
Whether to parse /tell infos
default: false
bchat.configuration.adopt_chat.tooltip:
Adopt the settings from the Chat Settings panel
If true, all the settings below will be invalid!
default: true
bchat.configuration.text_size.tooltip:
Size of the bullet text
default: 1.0
bchat.configuration.line_spacing.tooltip:
The size of line spacing
default: 0.0
bchat.configuration.top_offset.tooltip:
Bullet display offset on top
Unit: SP
default: 0
bchat.configuration.track_num.tooltip:
Number of bullet tracks on screen
This value will be chopped by other settings
